  • Cheng et al.

Cheng et al.Â¶

As part of our paper we try to reproduce other state-of-the-art approaches for EM semantic segmentation that do not provide code. In this case the following paper has been reproduced:

H. Cheng and A. Varshney, "Volume segmentation using convolutional neural networks with
limited training data", 2017 IEEE International Conference on Image Processing (ICIP),
Beijing, 2017, pp. 590-594.

[Paper] [Our code]

We have prepared three templates:

  • cheng_2D_template_V0.py : exact parameters and training workflow as described in the paper.

  • cheng_2D_template_V1.py : changes made respect to V0 with which we have achieved better results.

  • cheng_3D_template_V0.py : exact parameters and training workflow as described in the paper.

  • cheng_3D_template_V1.py : changes made respect to V0 with which we have achieved better results.

The implementation is based in one file:

  • 2D network : proposed 2D network.

  • 3D network : proposed 3D network.

  • loss : jaccard based loss proposed in the paper.

  • 2D stochastic downsampling : new layer proposed by the authors to make feature level augmentation.

  • 3D stochastic downsampling : 3D version of the previous layer.
